Name:
Tracker
Tracker
Ordered: as a Type C3-S-A1 hull, MCE hull 233[1]
Fate:
Returned to US Navy, 29 November 1946
Sold into merchant service
Displacement:
7,800 long tons (7,900 t) (standard)
14,170 long tons (14,400 t) (full load)
Length:
495 feet 8 inches (151.08 m) oa
465 feet (142 m) wl
Beam:
69 ft 6 in (21.18 m) wl
111 ft 6 in (33.99 m) (extreme width)
Installed power:
2 × 285 psi (1,970 kPa) steam boilers
8,500 shp (6,300 kW)
Armament:
2 × 4 in (102 mm)/50 cal guns
4 × twin 40 mm (1.57 in) Bofors guns
8 × twin 20 mm (0.79 in) Oerlikon cannons
10 × single Oerlikon cannons
Operations: Battle of the Atlantic, Normandy Landings
